# mergeChanges(fromContextDidSave:)

**Instance Method**

Merges the changes specified in a given notification.

## Declaration

```swift
func mergeChanges(fromContextDidSave notification: Notification)
```

## Parameters

- **notification**: An instance of an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSManagedObjectContextDidSave] notification posted by another context.

## Discussion

This method refreshes any objects which have been updated in the other context, faults in any newly-inserted objects, and invokes [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSManagedObjectContext/delete(_:)]: on those which have been deleted.

You can pass a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSManagedObjectContextDidSave] notification posted by a managed object context on another thread, however you must not use the managed objects in the user info dictionary directly. For more details, see Concurrency with Core Data.



## Managing concurrency

- **NSManagedObjectContextQueryGenerationKey**: Constant used to reference the query generation token.
- **mergeChanges(fromRemoteContextSave:into:)**: Handles changes from other processes or from a serialized state.
- **automaticallyMergesChangesFromParent**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the context automatically merges changes saved to its persistent store coordinator or parent context.
- **concurrencyType**: The concurrency type for the context.
- **mergePolicy**: The merge policy of the context.
- **queryGenerationToken**: Returns the token associated with the query generation currently in use by this context.
- **transactionAuthor**: The author for the context that is used as an identifier in persistent history transactions.
- **setQueryGenerationFrom(_:)**: Sets the query generation this context should use.
